devices are based around what we call sensors and actuators a sensor is a device that
senses the real world it picks up physical properties of the real world a
carbon dioxide sensor a temperature sensor for example humidity sensor pressure sensor pollution sensor
vibration sensor these are all devices that turn physical attributes of the world into electrical signals that can
be processed by a computer on the other end we have actuators that turn electrical signals into physical
interactions with the real world so like one of the canonical examples of this is an automated watering system so if you
have a garden you probably want your garden to be nice and watered so that your grass doesn't die your flowers
don't die and rather than just watering every night you can take a soil moisture sensor stick that in the ground that
